DOCNAME: CASE OF CEBOTARI AND OTHERS v. MOLDOVA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , PERSON , Mr PERSON and ORG , are NORP nationals , who were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in PERSON .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . The applicants were employees of a private company ( “ the company ” ) and were entitled to receive invalidity benefit . Since the company stopped paying them benefit in DATE , the applicants jointly brought an action against it , seeking payment of benefit arrears and requiring the former to pay the benefit for the rest of their lives .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ruled in favour of the applicants . It ordered the company to pay each of them invalidity benefit for DATE to DATE as follows : CARDINAL Moldovan lei ( MDL ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) to Mr PERSON ; MDL CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) to Mr PERSON ; MDL CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) to PERSON ; MDL CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) to Mr PERSON ; and MDL CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) to ORG . It also ordered the company to recalculate their respective benefits periodically and to pay it for the rest of their lives . On DATE the court issued enforcement warrants . The company ’s appeal was dismissed on DATE by ORG and on DATE by the final judgment of ORG .
CARDINAL . The enforcement warrants were sent to the bailiff on DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE the applicants lodged numerous complaints with various authorities about the non - enforcement of the judgment in their favour . In its replies ORG informed the applicants about the actions taken by ORG to enforce the judgment . On several occasions a bailiff made enquiries of ORG , ORG and ORG about the company ’s assets . He was informed that the company held numerous bank accounts which had been frozen by ORG , that the company did not have any real estate and that it owned several vehicles , later found to have been dismantled and allegedly to be of no value .

CARDINAL . In order to enforce the judgment in favour of the applicants , on DATE a bailiff seized a building , which , according to a certificate of CARDINAL DATE issued by ORG , belonged to a third company . On DATE a court annulled the sale by auction of that building .
CARDINAL . On DATE the company proposed to pay to each applicant MDL CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) , but they refused the offer .

CARDINAL . On DATE a bailiff seized CARDINAL items of the company ’s machinery and arranged for their sale at auction . On DATE a third party bank ( “ the bank ” ) sought annulment of the bailiff ’s actions on the ground that the machinery had been mortgaged by the company in DATE in order to guarantee a loan . Although the company ’s machinery was auctioned on DATE , following a request from the bank , on DATE the ORG annulled the auction . On DATE ORG ordered a stay of the enforcement proceedings in respect of the seized machinery , relying on a judgment of ORG of DATE by which a judicial dispute between the company and the bank had been determined in favour of the latter .

CARDINAL . By judgments of CARDINAL DATE and DATE ORG dismissed a third party bank action for the institution of insolvency proceedings against the company , relying on the company ’s financial report for DATE and its DATE report for DATE , revealing assets worth MDL CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) and MDL CARDINAL ( ORG MONEY ) , respectively .

CARDINAL . On DATE a bailiff made an enquiry of ORG ( “ NORP ” ) and was informed that the company had been inactive since DATE and held no assets and that on DATE the company ’s accounting records had been destroyed by fire .
CARDINAL . On DATE the company became the subject of insolvency proceedings and all enforcement proceedings against it were suspended .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the applicants brought an action against ORG and complained that the measures taken to enforce the judgment in their favour were inefficient . By a decision of DATE ORG upheld their action and held that ORG had failed to take effective action to enforce the judgment in favour of the applicants and ordered it to seize the company ’s assets recorded in the financial reports of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE a representative of the company informed the bailiff in charge of the enforcement about a change of the company ’s address and about the fact that it did not possess any assets in LOC . According to a report drawn up by a bailiff on DATE the company was not located at the newly indicated address .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE a bailiff requested ORG , ORG , ORG and ORG for assistance in enforcing the judgment in favour of the applicants . According to the information from ORG ( “ the GPE ” ) the company owned CARDINAL trucks , and on DATE ORG ordered the traffic police to search and to seize the vehicles . The decision however remained inoperative .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged with ORG a complaint against the bailiff ’s failure to comply with the decision of ORG of DATE . They also sought MDL CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) each in compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage suffered as a result of the inefficiency of the bailiff ’s actions . On DATE ORG dismissed their complaint on the ground of lack of jurisdiction ratione materiae and instructed them to initiate contentious proceedings against the bailiff .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants complied with the court ’s ruling and initiated contentious proceedings against the bailiff . On DATE , ORG dismissed their action on the ground of res judicata , referring to the decision of ORG of DATE .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , in DATE , a bailiff seized PERCENT of the company ’s shares in the statutory capital of a third company as well as CARDINAL items of machinery . In DATE and DATE he requested ORG of criminology and judiciary ( “ the Institute ” ) to evaluate the seized shares and assets . On both occasions the ORG refused to comply with the bailiff ’s request , stating that it had to be paid for the valuation in advance and that it had not been provided with certain documents . On DATE the Institute informed the bailiff that it could not comply with the request to evaluate the shares since it did not have qualified personnel for that purpose .

CARDINAL . On DATE a private company performed an evaluation of the shares and machinery . It estimated the value of the latter at MDL CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) , but the shares could not be evaluated since it did not have qualified personnel .

CARDINAL . On several occasions a bailiff requested the creditors of the company , including the applicants , to bear the fees for the announcement of an auction . On DATE an auction to sell the machinery took place but there were no buyers .

CARDINAL . On DATE a bailiff fixed another date for the auction . Since the debtors , including several ORG authorities , did not comply with the bailiff ’s request to bear the fees for the announcement of the auction , it has not taken place to date .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE a bailiff enforced a DATE judgment in favour of the company , according to which it had to be paid by private third parties MDL CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) . Since the company had debts worth MDL CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) , on DATE a bailiff distributed the amount recovered from the third parties between several of the company ’s creditors , including Mr PERSON , PERSON and PERSON Ion Nedin , who received MDL CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) , MDL CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) and MDL CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) , respectively .

CARDINAL . On DATE a bailiff evaluated PERCENT of the company ’s shares in the statutory capital of the third company at MDL CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) and seized it . The company ’s appeal against the bailiff ’s decision was dismissed on DATE . On DATE , the third company appealed against the bailiff ’s decision of DATE . The outcome of the proceedings is unknown .

CARDINAL . On DATE a bailiff issued a decision according to which the following amounts were to be distributed to the applicants : MDL MONEY ( EUR CARDINAL ) to Mr PERSON ; MDL CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) to Mr PERSON Gorbatii ; MDL CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) to PERSON ; MDL CARDINAL.CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) to Mr PERSON ; and MDL CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) to Mr Petru Anin .
CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON and PERSON received MDL CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) and MDL CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) , respectively .
CARDINAL . The judgment of DATE in favour of the applicants has not been fully enforced to date .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law has been set out in GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , ECHR CARDINALIII ( extracts ) ) .
